messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Basic Question
messages.msgSnippet: ... Good point. It s an ideal to head towards. If we don t have a clear idea where we re headed, it s hard to keep heading there! Joyce [Non-text portions of
messages.messageBody:
On Dec 15, 2007, at 9:47 AM, Genant2@... wrote:

>> Unschoolers model responsible behavior, respect and morality.
>> <<<<<<<<<
>
>
> Unschoolers try, some do, some don't, most not always. I know I
> am not
> always the best model...I try....I make mistakes. It's OK to make
> mistakes.
> It's OK to say you made a mistake.

Good point. It's an ideal to head towards. If we don't have a clear
idea where we're headed, it's hard to keep heading there!

Joyce

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Basic Question
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 12/15/2007 8:51:44 A.M. Eastern Standard Time, unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com writes: Unschoolers model responsible behavior, respect and
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 12/15/2007 8:51:44 A.M. Eastern Standard Time,
unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com writes:

Unschoolers model responsible behavior, respect and morality. <<<<<<<<<

Unschoolers try, some do, some don't, most not always. I know I am not
always the best model...I try....I make mistakes. It's OK to make mistakes.
It's OK to say you made a mistake.


Just a thought,
Pam G
